# Day 01

## Part 1

> Find the floor number where Santa ends up on.
> Starting on the ground floor (floor 0).\
> `(` = go up one floor.\
> `)` = go down one floor.

Simple arithmetics:

```js
const input = '((((()(()'

const up = input.match(/\(/g).length
const down = input.match(/\)/g).length
const result = up - down

console.log(result)
```

[_Try it out on flems.io_](https://flems.io/#--pF3LAd2em2siyHIbGabOSFYFJeqbSYkl4W9bVOyRbcMk7haxHDUu-oesBaY0Sa6VUS57xKe0u43OtUaBT6bmWstzz7C2njrdtHX2vmx23BtuLnYV2FnqaqZNctLm5RJMIVZMXzfayu1SSebnEi8kJrT0x20o9smSukhkRfZhzkvaZHbFFAXZhFEPrGSJLg6U9EMXqBJGSsCE1UNZk2kGCL--)

## Part 2

> Find the _nth_ parenthesis (starts from 1)
> which takes Santa to the basement (floor -1).

```js
let floor = 0
const result =
  1 +
  [...input].findIndex((parenthesis) => {
    floor += parenthesis === '(' ? 1 : -1
    return floor === -1
  })

console.log(result)
```

[_flems_](https://flems.io/#--pF3LAd2em2siyHIbGabOSFYFJeqbSYkl4W9bVOyRbcMk7haxHDUu-oesBaY0Sa6VUS57xKe0u43OtUaBT6bmWstzz7C2njrdtHX2vmx23BtuLnYV2FnqaqZNctLm5RJMIVZMXzfayu1SSebnEi8kJrT0x20o9smSukhkRfZhzkvaZHbFFAXZhFEPrGSJLg6U9EMXqBJGSsCE1UNZk2kGCL--)

Because the first parenthesis is at position 1
(as per the puzzle instructions),
the `1 +` before `[...input].findIndex()` is required.
Initializing `floor` to 1 and removing the `1 +`
would also provide the correct result,
but it would be confusing.

I don't like that I have to use a mutable variable (`floor`),
but I can't think of a cleaner solution.
I could use `reduce()`,
but I couldn't make it pretty.
Plus it would always loop through the whole `input` string;
`findIndex()` stops when the result has been found.

## What did I learn?

Nothing as this was a trivial puzzle.
